title: Progressive Web Apps
paragraph: A new way to deliver amazing user experiences on the web.

title: Custom elements
paragraph: Custom elements provide a component model for the web. These features let you build an element with its own public API that reacts to state changes.

title: Shadow DOM
paragraph: Shadow DOM lets you place the children in a scoped subtree, so document-level CSS can't restyle the button by accident, for example. This subtree is called a shadow tree.

title: Events
paragraph: Elements use events to communicate state changes up the DOM tree to parent elements.

title: Data system
paragraph: Each Polymer element manages its own data model and local DOM elements. The model for an element is the element's properties.

title: Define an element
paragraph: To define a custom element, create a class that extends Polymer.Element and pass the class to the customElements.define method.

title: Polymer App Toolbox
paragraph: Polymer App Toolbox is a collection of components, tools and templates for building Progressive Web Apps with Polymer. You can use any one of these components separately, or use them together to build a full-featured Progressive web app.

title: PRPL Pattern
paragraph: Currently, the Polymer CLI and reference server support a single-page app (SPA)

title: Build for production
paragraph: The build toolset can reduce the download size of your app and its elements by minifying your code.
